result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Lewis Andrews Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William Lewis Andrews Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ethan M. Padway appeared by video for William Lewis Andrews Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; on vacation. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (William L. Andrews, Jr. - #2022000181, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant William Lewis Andrews Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ethan M. Padway appeared by video for William Lewis Andrews Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Padway has been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing  scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William Lewis Andrews Jr not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with MAB (9/2/1989); JDJ (7/9/1994) and Sojourner Family Peace Center.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant William Lewis Andrews in court with attorney Erica N Young.  Defendant William Lewis Andrews in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  William Lewis Andrews appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3,4,6,7.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
